articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will mount a counteroffensive to try to retake territory in the Kursk region captured by Ukrainian troops, but Russian forces will encounter "a difficult fight," Deputy CIA Director David Cohen said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia faces "difficult fight" to retake Ukraine-held area, says top US spy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yemen's Iran-aligned Houthi group has agreed to a temporary truce to allow tugboats and rescue ships to reach the damaged Greek-flagged crude oil tanker Sounion in the Red Sea, Iran's mission to the United Nations in New York said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Iran says Houthis agree to truce so boats can reach damaged oil tanker

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces sent tanks deeper into Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip and launched strikes across the enclave as they battled Hamas-led militants, killing at least 34 Palestinians on Wednesday, according to medics.
articles.title: Israeli forces launch strikes across Gaza, push tanks into central Khan Younis

articles.author: Elizabeth Piper
articles.description: The 38-year-old father of four’s combat experience and sharp wit made him indispensable to Reuters journalists on the frontlines. ”Are you ok?” was a question Evans repeatedly asked.
articles.title: Ryan Evans, killed in Ukraine, played a vital role for Reuters

articles.author: Giulia Paravicini, Maggie Michael
articles.description: Investigators are looking at whether UN World Food Program staff sought to hide the alleged role of Sudan’s army in obstructing aid.
articles.title: Exclusive: WFP launches probe into its Sudan operations as famine spreads

articles.author: Christopher Bing
articles.description: An Iranian hacking group ran a fake professional recruiting business to lure national security officials across Iran, Syria and Lebanon into a cyber espionage trap, according to new research by U.S. cybersecurity firm Mandiant, a division of Alphabet's Google Cloud.
articles.title: Iran operated fake human-resources firm to root out unfriendly spies, researchers say

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: Top Chinese and U.S. officials discussed holding fresh talks between Presidents Joe Biden and Xi Jinping in the near future, the two countries said on Wednesday during high-level meetings in Beijing.
articles.title: Chinese, US officials discuss new round of talks between Biden and Xi

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: French investigative judges are due to decide later on Wednesday whether to place Russian-born Telegram boss Pavel Durov under formal investigation following his arrest as part of a probe into organised crime on the messaging app.
articles.title: French judges to decide on next step in Durov probe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian drones set oil tanks on fire at an depot in Russia's Rostov region, Russian Telegram channels reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Ukraine drones set oil depot ablaze in Russia's Rostov region, Telegram channels say

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Kamala Harris' campaign for U.S. president has hired an Egyptian American lawyer and former Department of Homeland Security official to help lead outreach to Arab American voters who hold sway in some states that could help decide the Nov. 5 election, two sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Harris' campaign hires Egyptian American lawyer for Arab voter outreach
